resources.string: Changelog

Project site: https://github.com/scoute-dich/Browser
Changelog: https://github.com/scoute-dich/browser/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md

Version: 5.4
Please read the \"Help dialog\" for more information.

\u25AA new: new app name "F|L|OSS Browser"
\u25AA new: dark and light theme
\u25AA new: startpage with all contents
\u25AA new: full support for cookie whitelist
\u25AA new: more options for fullscreen browsing
\u25AA new: more options visibility Navigation Button
\u25AA new: night mode only while browsing
\u25AA updated: help dialog
\u25AA removed: different light themes
\u25AA fix: double entries in history
\u25AA fix: toolbar does not work on start
\u25AA fix: keyboard issues in some cases (thanks: element54)
Startpage

Here you can access all your data: saved sites on the startpage, bookmarks, history, saved login data and the integrated file browser. In the settings you can decide which content will be shown at start.
Fast toggle

If you long press the \"menu\" or the \"Navigation button\" the \"Fast toggle dialog\" will open. Here you can change some important settings without leaving the current website. You can also add websites to your whitelist for AdBlocker, JavaScript or Cookies..
Toolbar

At the bottom of the screen you have the toolbar. You can enter URLs or search for something, reload the website and open the menu. Long click on the \"menu button\" to open the \"Fast toggle menu\". Swipe the toolbar up to open the tab preview. To switch between tabs swipe left or right.
Tab preview
Click the preview of a tab to select it, click again to close the tab preview. To close a tab simply swipe to preview to the top or bottom.
Menu

Share or save content, handle the current tab: just try all entries to see what is possible. With the buttons on the top right you can switch to the previous/next site in your history. Clicking the \"Circle button\" will open the Startpage in the current tab. The menu can be dismissed, like all other notifications, by clicking back, clicking outside the menu or simply be swiping the menu down.
Notifications
Notifications are displayed on the bottom of the screen. They can also be dismissed like the menus.
Navigation
There are even more options in the settings. Try it out!

On following sites you can get more information about \"F|L|OSS Browser\":

XDA-thread:
XDA is a great community for developers and smartphone enthusiasts. Here you can report issues, ask for new features and everything other related to \"F|L|OSS Browser\".
https://forum.xda-developers.com/android/apps-games/app-browser-t3500091

Github:
On Github you can see the source code of \"F|L|OSS Browser\". This is the more technical solution: open issues, ask for new features or even help developing or translating.
https://github.com/scoute-dich/browser
